programme.title: Flipping Out
programme.desc: The team heads to New York City; it's Monroe's first trip, making Jeff and Gage nervous; Jeff charters a private plane and brings along Monroe's nanny and grandparents; the team searches for real estate for Jeff's client, Julie Grossi.

programme.desc: Jeff's project managers clash, only adding to the chaos he was hoping to alleviate; neighbor Lea Black is back in town and ready to get to work on renovating her kitchen; Jeff runs into trouble with another neighbor.

programme.sub-title: The Straw(berry) That Broke the Camel's Back

programme.title: Flipping Out
programme.desc: Julie's overly-involved approach to the flipping process clashes with Jeff's working style; with construction completed, the group sets out to furnish Heather's place; Valley Vista sees more personnel changes.

programme.title: Flipping Out
programme.desc: Attempting to start fresh, Jeff turns to friend Teddi Mellencamp's accountability program; JLD finds out that clients Liat and Trevor are headed for divorce; Jenni finds her dream home and hopes to quickly sell her house.

programme.title: Flipping Out
programme.desc: Jeff is concerned with pleasing his new client's girlfriend who will be making most of the design decisions; Lea Black is in town to get started on her kitchen demolition; Jeff realizes his employees lack motivation; Megan makes a difficult decision.

programme.title: Flipping Out
programme.desc: Lea Black leads a productivity seminar at Jeff Lewis Design, which brings a lot of issues to the surface and sparks a mass exodus; Jeff and Jenni have it out; Jeff and Jenni's relationship may not survive, and Jeff may not have any employees left.

programme.desc: Jeff Lewis looks to his personal psychic for guidance as he deals with an overbearing employee and a troublesome piece of neglected property.
